snippet: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki’s decision to replace Hoshyar Zebari came as Kurds seized two oil production facilities in Kirkuk Province.
abstract: Struggle between leadership of Iraq and country's Kurdish minority intensifies as Kurds seize two oil production facilities in Kirkuk Province and Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki replaces Foreign Min Hoshyar Zebari, a Kurd, with Hussain Shahristani, a Shiite.

byline.contributor: Omar al-Jaworky contributed reporting from Baghdad, and an employee of The New York Times from Kirkuk, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki’s decision to replace Hoshyar Zebari came as Kurds seized two oil production facilities in Kirkuk Province.

headline.main: Rift With Kurds Widens as Iraqi Leader Replaces the Foreign Minister
headline.print_headline: Rift With Kurds Widens as Iraqi Leader Replaces the Foreign Minister

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
